INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was tripped and kicked by a Staff 1.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit. He informed that Youth A
was still present at the facility and could be interviewed. Administrator 1
stated that Staff 1 was on leave as a result of the incident.
Youth A was interviewed on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and Law
Enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit. Youth A stated
that he has been placed at the facility for a few months. He recalled the
incident and question occurred in the school area of the building. Youth
2

A stated that this incident happened the morning of the interview. He
stated that he was trying to go to the school so he could find one of his
teachers, and Staff 1 followed him there. Youth A stated that Staff 1
slammed a door to a classroom in his face, tripped him, and kicked him
in his back after Youth A had tripped and fell down on his side. Youth A
recalled that Staff 2 came into the school hallway area at that point.
Youth A remembered that he then ran into the training room, which is a
separate area of the building. He did not believe that Staff 2 saw him
get tripped or kicked. Youth A stated that the kick felt like the tip of Staff
1’s foot. Youth A stated that Staff 1 didn’t say anything other than “get
up” when Youth A had tripped. He stated that he has not had any
issues with Staff 1 in the past. However Youth A then stated he recalled
that Staff 1 pushed him while Youth A was still in the unit, and this
occurred prior to the alleged, tripping and kicking. Youth A stated that
he was trying to leave the unit and pushed Staff 1 out of the way. Staff
1 allegedly held out his hand to Youth A’s chest. Youth A recalled that
Staff 1 asked him “Why are you trying to leave?” Youth A stated that
he understands that he is not allowed to just leave the unit anytime he
wants to. He believes that no one else saw the alleged push, because
the other staff was attending to other youth. Youth A stated that he did
not wish to speak anymore about the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/05/2022 with DHHS Worker 1 and law
enforcement during an unannounced face-to-face visit at the facility.
Staff 1 stated that he recalled the alleged incident occurring around
7:15 AM that morning. Youth A came out of his unit as instructed to get
an over-the-counter medication. As Youth A walked into the common
area Staff 1 recalled that Youth A began to run around. Staff 1
remembered Youth A kicking the training room door that was locked
and then running into the school area. Staff 1 does not recall Youth A
saying much as he escalated, but he has had experience with Youth A
escalating quickly and out of nowhere in the past. Staff 1 went into the
classroom area of the building, and Youth A ran out of a classroom
doorway and fell onto the floor. Staff 1 denied that Youth A tripped over
him. Staff 1 reported that another staff was present, Staff 2, who
would’ve witnessed this part of the incident. Staff 1 stated that he did
not trip, kick, or touch Youth A. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A had been
trying to get out of the unit much of the morning prior to this incident.
One tactic Staff 1recalled using in response to this was doing a “arm
check.” This meant that he put his arm up to keep Youth A at arms
length away from him because Youth A can struggle with physical
boundary issues. Staff 1 then continued to describe the incident. After
Youth A fell to the floor, he got up and ran to the training room where
another staff, he was unsure of which staff, attempted to de-escalate
him. Staff 1 then reiterated that he did not kick or hit Youth A, and noted
that because of his large size and heavy boots, he would be concerned
4

about injuries to Youth A if something like that were to occur. Staff 1
stated that he has seen Youth A escalate many times, but he has not
had issues or allegations like this come up in the past.
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D were interviewed with DHHS Worker 1
on 12/14/2022 during an announced face-to-face visit. Each of them
has resided in a unit with Youth A, but none were witness to the
incident in question. They each were able to remember some facet of
Youth A being escalated the Monday morning of the alleged incident,
but none ever saw Youth A trip or Staff 1 put his hands on Youth A in
anyway. All three youth stated that they have not had any issues with
Staff 1 and spoke positively of him.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/14/2022 jointly with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit. Staff 2 recalled the morning of
the incident and remembered Youth A being escalated. He stated that
Youth A is a “walker “and likes to walk out of the unit about once a day.
Staff 2 recalled hearing Youth A yelling in the school area and he went
there to find out what’s going on. Staff 2 remembered Staff 1 being able
to have line of sight of Youth A at that moment but was never within
arms reach of Youth A. Staff 2 recalled hearing Staff 1 ask Youth A
what was wrong and hearing Youth A yell back to leave him alone. Staff
2‘s recollection was that Staff 1 appropriately attempted to de-escalate
and help figure out what was going on with Youth A. Staff 2 stated that
he heard Youth A state that Staff 1 had “messed with him” but then
immediately stated that this was not actually true. Youth A then stated
something to the effect of being upset about another youth’s actions.
Staff 2 recalled Youth A then walking toward the school area and both
Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed. Staff 2 stated that he saw Youth A trying to
break into one of the classrooms in the school and Staff 1 placed his
hand on the door handle to not allow this. Staff 2 stated that, at this
point, Youth A fell back and claimed that Staff 1 hit him. Staff 2 stated
that he witnessed this entire part of the incident and stated that Staff 1
did not put his hands on Youth A at any point, nor did he kick or trip
him. As Youth A got up and ran to another area of the building, Staff 2
stated that he told Staff 1 to stay back and allow him to attempt to
follow Youth A and de-escalate him. Staff 2 stated that he followed
Youth A for another couple minutes and they eventually were able to sit
down in the training room and talk while Youth A de-escalated. At that
point Youth A continued to claim that Staff 1 hit him. Staff 2 stated that
he attempted to talk Youth A through what he witnessed of the incident,
which included, no hitting, kicking, or tripping. Staff 2 stated that he has
worked off and on with Staff 1 during his employment with the facility for
the last year and he has never seen a Staff 1 be verbally or physically
aggressive with any youth.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/14/2022 during an
announced face-to-face visit. He stated that he has had experience with
Youth A on third shifts, because Youth A struggles with transitions and
likes to walk out of the unit and has trouble being held accountable. He
stated that he was working the night shift of this incident and had not
left the building yet when this occurred. Staff 3 stated that he did not
witness the incident, but he also did not hear Youth A state anything
about it immediately afterwards before his shift ended. Staff 3 stated
that Staff 1 never mentioned the incident either in their time working
together since then.
Supervisor 1/Complainant was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/14/2022 during an announced face-to-face visit at the facility. She
stated she arrived at the building in the immediate aftermath of the
classroom portion of this incident. Supervisor 1 recalled that Youth A
told her that Staff 1 blocked the door in a classroom and Staff 2 saw
Youth A on the floor after Staff 1 allegedly kicked him. Supervisor 1
then stated that Youth A soon afterwards changed his story and stated
that Staff 2 would not have seen anything. Supervisor 1 confirmed that
Youth A was provided medical attention that same day. The nurse did
not see any bruises in any form that would be consistent with being
kicked in the back as Youth A initially described. Supervisor 1 stated
that her role as a program manager has allowed her to get to know staff
strengths and weakness as well, and she has not seen any concerning
issues with Staff 1. Supervisor 1 stated that she has not seen him
become verbally or physically aggressive with any youth.
Therapist 1 was interviewed on 12/14/2022 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit. He recalled that Youth A had
talked to him on Tuesday 12/06/2022 for a normal therapy session and
this incident came up only briefly. Therapist 1 stated that Youth A did
not proactively bring up Staff 1 or the incident, but over the course of a
family therapy session Youth A mentioned “that’s why I’m pressing
charges on Staff 1” and then “I’m not going to talk about it anymore.”
Therapist 1 stated that he has had concerns in the past with Youth A’s
recollection of incidents, as well as Youth A struggling with emotional
regulation and using things that are untrue as a tactic to deflect from
what he could be actually working on.
During a conference call on 01/04/2023 DHHS Worker 1 reported there
was no preponderance of evidence, and no staff members will have a
confirmed case.
Documents that were reviewed over the course of this
investigation:
4

- Employee personnel file for Staff 1. Discipline was found over the
course of Staff 1’s 16 years at the facility including: 26 instances of
write ups for timeliness, 10 instances of not responding to escalated
youth properly, one improper restraint, and two incidences of personal
conduct.
- Incident report dated 12/05/2022. The incident report was consistent
with interviews conducted for the investigation.
- Nursing note documentation for Youth A dated 12/05/2022. This
documentation confirmed no injuries for Youth A.
- Written statement gathered by the facility from Staff 1 dated
12/05/2022. This statement was consistent with his interview.
- Police report from Vassar Police Department dated 12/28/2022
confirming no charges were filed against Staff 1.
Analysis Through face-to-face interviews of staff and youth at the facility as well
as documentation review it was found that there was not sufficient
evidence to show that there was a rule violation as a result of the
alleged incident. It is inconclusive that Staff 1 hit or kicked Youth A
based on eyewitness accounts as well as medical attention provided
after the fact.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
